member.summary: Creates a part-level relationship between this IPackagePart to a specified target IPackagePart or external resource.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Core.Sgml.CaseFolding
member.summary: SGML is case insensitive, so here you can choose between converting to lower case or upper case tags. "None" means that the case is left alone, except that end tags will be folded to match the start tags.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Core.Sgml.HWStack
member.summary: This stack maintains a high water mark for allocated objects so the client can reuse the objects in the stack to reduce memory allocations, this is used to maintain current state of the parser for element stack, and attributes in each element.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Core.Sgml.Attribute
member.summary: This class represents an attribute. The AttDef is assigned from a validation process, and is used to provide default values.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Core.Sgml.Attribute.Reset(System.String,System.String,System.Char)
member.summary: Attribute objects are reused during parsing to reduce memory allocations, hence the Reset method.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Core.Sgml.Node
M:Infragistics.Documents.Core.Sgml.Node.Reset(System.String,System.Xml.XmlNodeType,System.String)
member.summary: Attribute objects are reused during parsing to reduce memory allocations, hence the Reset method.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Core.Sgml.SgmlReader
member.summary: SgmlReader is an XmlReader API over any SGML document (including built in support for HTML).

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Core.Sgml.SgmlReader.SetBaseUri(System.String)
member.summary: The base Uri is used to resolve relative Uri's like the SystemLiteral and Href properties. This is a method because BaseURI is a read-only property on the base XmlReader class.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Core.Sgml.SgmlReader.Dtd
member.summary: Specify the SgmlDtd object directly. This allows you to cache the Dtd and share it across multipl SgmlReaders. To load a DTD from a URL use the SystemLiteral property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Core.Sgml.SgmlReader.DocType
member.summary: The name of root element specified in the DOCTYPE tag.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Core.Sgml.SgmlReader.PublicIdentifier
member.summary: The PUBLIC identifier in the DOCTYPE tag

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Core.Sgml.SgmlReader.SystemLiteral
member.summary: The SYSTEM literal in the DOCTYPE tag identifying the location of the DTD.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Core.Sgml.SgmlReader.InternalSubset
member.summary: The DTD internal subset in the DOCTYPE tag

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Core.Sgml.SgmlReader.InputStream
member.summary: The input stream containing SGML data to parse. You must specify this property or the Href property before calling Read().

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Core.Sgml.SgmlReader.WebProxy
member.summary: Sometimes you need to specify a proxy server in order to load data via HTTP from outside the firewall. For example: "itgproxy:80".

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Core.Sgml.SgmlReader.Href
member.summary: Specify the location of the input SGML document as a URL.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Core.Sgml.SgmlReader.StripDocType
member.summary: Whether to strip out the DOCTYPE tag from the output (default true)

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Core.Sgml.SgmlReader.ErrorLog
member.summary: DTD validation errors are written to this stream.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Core.Utilities.SortMergeGeneric``1(System.Collections.Generic.List{``0},System.Collections.Generic.IComparer{``0})
member.summary: Sorts the passed in list based on the passed in comparer using a modified merge-sort algorithm.
member.param: The list to be sorted.
The comparer (must not be null).

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Core.Utilities.SortMergeGeneric``1(``0[],``0[],System.Collections.Generic.IComparer{``0})
member.summary: Sorts the passed in array based on the passed in comparer using a modified merge-sort algorithm. Optionally you can pass in a temporary array equal (or greater) in size to arr. The method will make use of that array instead of allocating one. If null is passed in, then it will allocate one. Merge sort should be used if the operation of comparing items is expensive.
member.param: Array to be sorted.
Null or a temporary array equal (or greater) in size to arr.
Comparer.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Core.Utilities.SortMergeGeneric``1(``0[],``0[],System.Collections.Generic.IComparer{``0},System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sorts the passed in array based on the passed in comparer using a modified merge-sort algorithm. Optionally you can pass in a temporary array equal (or greater) in size to arr. The method will make use of that array instead of allocating one. If null is passed in, then it will allocate one. Merge sort should be used if the operation of comparing items is expensive.
member.param: Array to be sorted.
Null or a temporary array equal (or greater) in size to arr.
Comparer.
Start index in the array.
End index in the array.
